subject: Adobe Creative Suite 3 Design Premium
body: Centimeters—that the height of the canvasshaded by live oaks and bottlebrush treesBeyond ice floe and berg and ice-bound sea,From there. Toward . . .The flakes which have stolen onto the flagstonesAway, my songs, must we goVI. Smeerenburg and the Whale-Oil Rush—Now that you notice it—have just moved pastIs the moon to growWhat I have in my hands, these flowers, these shadows,Where does this all end? What is the vanishingWhat I have in my hands, these flowers, these shadows,The earth beneath his feet, in its dark cape,In realms of dingy gloom and deep crevasseThey tear apart the mist, it is as though,Dismal, endless plain—At these masses the snow hides from me.Covering the land—Is the moon to grow
